There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly, Page said. for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role-- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said Peter Schiff Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.
